page.title: 16CAMERTON AND ITS CHURCH
page.content: The church of St.Peter was once the only church in the parish of Seaton and Camerton.It stands at the extreme end of the parish and is in the Early English style. It is said to stand on a site where there had been early christian worship for over 1000 years previously. Unlike many churches, the village did not grow up around it, but lies some distance away. Consisting of a chancel and chapel, with a western tower, a spire was added in 1855. In the chapel there is an altar tomb, with the effigy of a warrior, known as 'Black Tom of the North', a member of the Curwen family, the local landowners.Black Tom is in fact buried in Shap Abbey. He was famous as a bulwark against the marauding border Scots raiders. During a restoration in 1892,ancient stones were discovered.
